benchmark_details.name: CHED (Contextual Hop Editing Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: CHED is a benchmark designed to evaluate the context robustness of knowledge editing methods in language models, assessing how well they perform when presented with distracting preceding contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging evaluation for knowledge editing techniques by incorporating realistic context scenarios that affect editing performance.

data.source: Constructed dataset using prefix contexts derived from Wikidata and existing knowledge editing instances.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on the model's ability to correctly edit knowledge while excluding original entries.
methodology.interpretation: High efficacy indicates successful knowledge editing under context variability.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using various existing knowledge editing methods.
